ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often were you bothered by each of the following problems in the past 2 weeks? Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: How often were you bothered by each of the following problems in the past 2 weeks? Not being able to stop or control your worrying
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: How often were you bothered by each of the following problems in the past 2 weeks? Worrying too much about different things
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Having trouble relaxing
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Being so restless that it was hard to sit still
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several Days; 2= More than half the days; 3= Nearly everyday

ElementDescription: How difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people in the past 2 weeks?
Notes: 1= Extremely Difficult; 2= Very Difficult;  3= Somewhat Difficult; 4= Not difficult at all

ElementDescription: How old were you the very first time you had an episode of worry or anxiety and related problems lasting 2 weeks or longer?
About how many different years in your life did you have an episode of worry or anxiety and related problems lasting 2 weeks or longer?
How many months in the past 12 did you have an episode of worry or anxiety and related problems?

Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
